info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:17AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A moderate band of snow will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Pondera, northwestern Judith Basin, southeastern Teton, Hill, Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 145 AM MST... At 112 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a moderate band of snow along a line extending from northwest Hill county to central Lewis and Clark county. Movement was east southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Snow, with visibility below one half mile at times. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Snowfall, with visibility below one half mile. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Havre, Fort Benton, Cascade, Big Sandy, Lincoln, Fairfield, Belt, Geraldine, Parker School, Highwood, Azure, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Beaver Creek, Fort Shaw, The Knees, Augusta, Agency and St. Pierre. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 229 and 312. Highway 200 between between mile markers 66 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 40. Highway 2 between mile markers 341 and 390. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
